description:
My first time at this Lemonade location. It's been a while since I've been to Lemonade. 
Have to say that the staff are very personable and had offered to walk us through the menu selection and options.  It's been a while since we last visited Lemonade. 
The Lemonade on 9th ave near Irving street was really nice it's so beautifully decorated and much cleaner than the one near YBG on 4 th Street. 

Love the decor and plenty of seating food is good too great salads and side selections. Love the Harissa spiced roasted cauliflower.  Please go easy on the salt on the sautéed kale
author: P C.

description:
I can see why this location has such a poor rating. I show up to pick up my order and all the staff just stand around with a clueless look on their faces while they walk around pretending to look like they're busy doing something. The  place has not a single customer in it and yet service is nowhere to be found. Then I see one of the chefs, Debbie, and she kindly but with a look of frustration tells me that she'll find Mike to help me since apparently that's what he's in charge of.

Mike walks over from around the corner and proceeds to fumble around with the order bringing the same two salads from back and forth between the kitchen to where I'm waiting. He sets the items on the table without even bagging them up and says "there you go" and walks back to where he had been sitting and chatting with some person. For the order to not be ready on time and for the shit-show of a service experience Mike provided I would have to say this is the least professional staff I have witnessed. 

Pro tip: I also saw one of the staff change a garbage can's bag with the same gloves she has used to touch food. 

Thanks Lemonade.
author: Phi P.

description:
To my surprised they serve more than just lemonade! Place is clean and simple, like a lemonade stand should be.
Their lemonade is decent, nothing "wowing" or special. Didn't get to try too much of what they had to offer, but I can say, their mac and cheese sucks.
Its soggy and tasted like cheap powered melted cheese. I hope the rest of their food was better.
author: Mary T.

description:
I really love this concept of fresh food that's deliciously gourmet served with awesome service, all cafeteria style.

This was my second time at Lemonade and an everyday lunch was much more posh than we're used to: I usually don't source out nor whip up white truffle Mac n cheese or red miso short ribs. A simple tomato and avocado salad isn't usually tossed with roasted pine nuts- but it should be! 

It's not just the twist on comfort food or the three kinds of poke they featured that day; it's the amazingly friendly, service-oriented staff they hire. 

The employees are tremendous, all focused on the customer experience. The restaurant is clean and organized. Even the flooring-  patterned with lemon slices -is friendly and makes me smile. 

I feel happy when I look at the wall garden that's the restaurant's entry to the greeting I've received as if I'm a welcome friend or frequent customer- which I haven't become- yet.

You can ask for samples, order à la carte or choose plates to have hot and cold items assembled for you. 

And the lemonades are so delicious. The rosemary-watermelon is particularly refreshing but they have several flavor combinations to try. 

And I'll tell you, the next time we have a record-breaking 106-degree day like we had last September, I'm heading over to Lemonade for one of their frozen lemonade slushies.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Newest location just opened in the Inner Sunset and it was fantastic.  Managers were there to answer any questions and the staff was helpful in helping people to choose from the large variety

i chose the steak BLT with a bean salad and chips.  I also adde a blood irange lemonade.  $15 later I was very satisfied.  Interestingly enough I had been by the other locations in the city plenty of times but this was the first time I was drawn in.  It was a beatiful day and I was near the park, so the outdoor seating was welcoming.  

what I like was the eseof orderung and then they give you a number and they bring you your food.  I can see lots of peole cmbing the place with a visit to the park.

Not sure why others don't give this place better reviews.  I am defiitely come back here to try their cookies and many other things on the menu.

============

Not sure why Yelp says this was my first visit.  Still enjoy the place although it doesn't seem as trendy as when I first came here and that is a good thing.  I really enjoy the retro 70s yellowy feel.  I don't kboe what it is but the ordering process always feels weird.  I can never get it right and I fell as though they havebitbset up linearly that people have to walk back and forth to see items.  Not a big deal though when there isnt a big line.
author: Erik H.

description:
Came here for a quick dinner.

Had the following: 
1. Citrus Poached Salmon Filet - It tasted like an ordinary poached salmon. I didn't taste the citrus much.  Too expensive.  Look at my photo..that was 7 bucks...seriously? 

2. Shaved Brussel Sprouts and Dates - really good. The sweet dates were the best part. Probably my favorite of the 3 sides I got. 

3. Avocado & Cherry Tomatoes - okayy. I'm not a fan of tomatoes but it was okay. 

4. Turkey Bit Panzella - good.  The bacon is really strong. 

The food is like california fresh. I like that the portions aren't huge and I feel like it is a healthy option compared to other things out there. 

TL;DR: I would probably come back because it's convenient relatively healthy food.  The protein options are way too expensive.
author: Jon P.

description: I used to drive from Sacramento just for lemonade, but these last 3 trips the customer service has been horrific!! They messed up our order twice & when i asked for pesto  the girl whipped her glove on her dirty shirt and served me food. Rip. I asked why my BLT salad didn't have croutons and she said idk. lol ?!??? Never again.
author: Kristina P.

description: Hi guys I don't expect to treat me as a King but when any person who orders to go, the napkins and silverware should  come with that order. Thank you
author: Kudrat K.

description:
3.5 stars
A clean, modern, casual chain of healthy fast food restaurants with origins in southern California, Lemonade is spreading throughout the Bay Area as well. It has a cafeteria style set-up and you can choose from a variety of prepared dishes either a la carte or on combination plates. You can even sample nearly anything before you order--on my most recent visit, we selected a wide variety of things to share, and some of the standouts to me included the Brussels sprouts with dates (what an interesting pairing!), the salmon/avocado "Louie", butternut squash with corn and corn nuts (fascinating textural contrast), the Thai green curry with chicken meatballs (lovely lemongrass flavor), harissa cauliflower, curried cauliflower with almonds, broccoli with ricotta, and spicy green beans with chicken. I was definitely impressed by how flavorful all of these veggie-centric dishes were. However, some of the items looked like they had been sitting around for quite a while--the avocado in the avocado/salmon Louie was turning brown, and the pre-marinated soy ginger salmon poke we ordered was definitely losing its freshness as well. While I'm a fan in general of Lemonade, I've also had somewhat inconsistent experiences here, but it's still definitely worth a stop for a quick, casual meal!
author: David K.

description: This place is terrible!!! I got an avacado and cherry tomato salad and all they gave me was tomato ans not one piece of avocado.
author: Vivian K.

description:
Still not so sure why I decided to have lunch here instead of Pluto's.. my mind was set on sweet potato fries and a customized salad, but nope, I ended up here. I should've learned my lesson from last time.

The wait was long. The line was building up almost out the door. 

The food here just doesn't do it for me, even after giving it a second try. This time I had ordered the chef's plate which included a choice of meat and two sides. I went with mashed potatoes and some brussel sprout salad that seemed to be super popular. The best thing was probably the mashed potatoes. Everything else was just subpar. Although the roast chicken was juicy and tender, it wasn't the greatest I've had. 

I'm all about the watermelon rosemary lemonade though! Only thing I'd come back for.
author: Sydney C.

description:
Worst Lemonade I have ever been to. 

We came here for a late lunch and the place was really empty. However, we waited 45 minutes for a very sorry, over cooked side of "steak" to be delivered to our table. They had completely forgot about it and hardly apologized. All the staff were really confused when we asked where the main part of our plate was, and were like "really?"

Finally after 45 MINUTES, they brought this really pathetic plate out, and one staff member said that we could have a dessert on them. Really? A dessert? No, I want my money back.

Horrible horrible service and experience.
author: Shelley C.

description: It's a nice quality food line. Lots of different varieties from salad, sandwiches and hot foods. I got the California picnic bundle: Her Chicken sandwich was delicious and I was told it was a popular choice. It came with chips and our choice of side. We had the pasta with tomatoes, yum!  I really liked that we were able to taste the sides before committing to one. We tasted the different lemonades and agreed that the cucumber mint was our favorite.
author: Jade W.

description:
walking down ninth street we were originally going to eat at nopalito, but once we saw lemonade we had to go inside. i've never been to a lemonade before so this was v exciting! 

I opted to get a couple of sides -

edamame & radish salad: yum! super fresh and balanced. totally going to try and re-create this dish. 

butternut squash salad: it was just okay! i thought the butternut squash could have been cooked a tiny bit longer. it was a bit bland imo. it did have something crunchy in it which i enjoyed. 

truffle mac 'n cheese: uhmmmm 100 p the best mac 'n cheese i've ever tasted! sooo creamy and truffle-y. i die. 

cucumber & mint lemonade: i don't generally drink lemonade, but was thinking yolo since it was my first time in. the cashier was super nice letting us try the different flavors. i opted for this one and asked them to only fill it halfway and i filled the rest of my cup up with water so it wasn't as sweet. it was good, but prob wouldn't order again. 

my friend got the poke bowl. she said it was tasty, but there could have been more fish and less rice. 

in all i will definitely be back! my three sides and drink came out to $11 which i think is pretty cheap for how big the portions of the sides were. 

p.s. can you open one in san jose next? thanks.
author: Kirsten M.

description: This place looks like a cafeteria for androgynous post-hipster kids with autism. Very cozy. They have a meal  with one protein (8oz?) and 2 veggies for $15. Not bad. I opted for the steak with broccoli feta salad and traditional  N . It took 10 mins to cook the . The steak was seasoned good. The broccoli salad was cold but still good. The MAC was really good and had a thick texture too it almost like a casserole. Would give this place 4 stars if the food had been hot or at least warm. Would go to Pluto's before lemonade but this place has far more options and 25,000 flavors of their namesake to drink. 3.5 stars
author: Johny B.

description:
"When life gives you lemons, make Lemonade" they say...

I was happy to find out that Lemonade has landed in The Sunset, considering it is one of my favorite, healthy, "fast-food" joints I've tried in the past.

I came in at 11:30, so I definitely beat the lunch rush, and was completely satisfied with the entire dining experience at Lemonade. First, I LOVE how much natural light this restaurant gets and the covered patio that is the perfect balance between being inside and outside. 

Second, the food was delicious ! Everything is super fresh & well seasoned, theres LOTS of options, you can sample everything before making your choices, and the employees were very helpful and friendly. All of these things make me an instant fan of Lemonade, and I'll definitely be back!
author: Ruhama G.

description:
First off, this Lemonade location is a lot better than the one located in downtown San Francisco. There's a lot better lighting, the seating is more wide and spread out, the workers are more helpful, and the menu presentation definitely looks way better.

When I first entered the store, there was a nice lady that offered us assistance on how ordering worked. She was super friendly and bubbly. However, the workers that scooped the food seemed a bit confused and dazed. I wanted the chef's plate ($13 -- 1 protein, 2 sides, and a piece of bread) but the lady behind the counter repeatedly asked what I wanted. I'd chalked this up due to the store being new though. So hopefully it'll get better!

I got the tender steak with chimichurri sauce, truffled mac and cheese, and the mashed potatoes. I really like the two sides, but I was a bit disappointed in the steak. It was cold and tasted like it was sitting there for awhile. The two sides were served hot and were really really creamy. I also got the peach ginger lemonade and thought the lemonade was the best part of the whole meal.

Nonetheless, I thought the whole experience was pretty positive and this restaurant is a great addition to the sunset neighborhood. I'd recommend a try and to definitely sample out some of the food/lemonade!
author: Victor L.

description:
I like that one can sample their food and drinks. I sampled the lemonades and chose the blood orange. (They obviously have a lot of sugar in them, but are quite refreshing after a visit to the Botanical Gardens.)

I snatched some bites off my husband's salads and liked one that was something like shaved Brussels sprouts with figs, dates, Parmesan and capers.

Teens seem to like this place as my stepdaughter was pushing hard for it.
author: Camille L.

description:
This place was so cute!! Friendly service from the dude.. but the girl cashier not so much. Maybe she was having a rough day.. but 

the food was so good!! My sister and I shared a BLT sandwich. There's soo much Turkey!  but I could've used a lil more bacon  

since it was my first time there, i had to stick to the original old fashioned lemonade. Perfect. My sister got the watermelon rosemary drink. Perfect balance of both flavors! 

We got the green bean salad that had chicken, peppers, and I believe some pineapple. It was jus like the dude described it: spicy, sweet, & crunchy! Yummy. 

There was also a side of chips that came with the meal. Idk what they were, but I wanted more because 1 I love chips 2 they're so yummy

I wanna go again but next time try the poke bowls!! The fish looked appetizing
author: Lizzy C.

description: Service was deplorable, meat was dry, vegetables were over cooked again service was really reelly bad.
author: Lo L.

description:
Lemonade can be hit or miss.

Their in store set-up is always a little disorganized - no matter what location you're at  - so be prepared for a little confusion -  both when you're ordering and paying.

I like to come to this location when I want something low-key to eat.

My go-to order is Lemonade's curried cauliflower, their hot brussels sprouts side, their salmon, all topped off with a side of the green curry sauce from their chicken meatball dish. 

I don't think Lemonade's food is organic or particularly memorable, but if you want something relatively quick on a mellow afternoon or evening - Lemonade's a worthwhile stop.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Variety​ of food collection, from cool to hot, from beverage to dessert, but it is little pricy, not a high-value​ spot to go.
author: Faye L.

description:
I stopped by here today on my way to the Academy of Science. It was early - around 11:30 or so - and no one was in line.

I was greeted by one of the chefs (I assume) and another woman. I only stopped in to get something quick but as others have said, the menu is a bit too busy and wasn't easy to find something to order.

All the food looked really good but I wanted to order something quickly so I went ahi tuna poke bowl. At first, it didn't seem like they put a whole lot of the mix poke in there but they added crispy garlic, sesame seeds, a bit of seaweed salad, and some other stuff and can't quite recall. Regardless, it was super tasty and actually it was hard to finish. I probably shouldn't have finished but it was so tasty that I had to go for the finish line.

Anyway, overall I was impressed. One downer though was that they strangely didn't have chopsticks when I left the counter. I asked the woman and she said yes we do but she ended up searching around for them so I just left with a fork.
author: Art O.

description: This place is pretty good for a fairly quick bite and is quite healthy. I'd give it more like 3.5-3.75 stars bc it is very chain-feeling, but I do appreciate the variety of options (especially vegetarian) and they're decent to pretty good. The lemonade itself isn't too special except that it comes in fun colors
author: Madeline C.

description: The mango chicken bowl is yummy and was a full meal for me. Prompt service too. Would go back.
author: Danny O.

description:
They encourage you to sample the food, so definitely do because some of it taste way better than the description.

#1 Had some of the kale and strawberry's and I hate Kale (tbh I hate vegetables period) but they add some (blue?) cheese which I enjoyed! 

#2 Salmon Poke. Didn't real taste the Thai peanut sauce but I enjoyed the salmon a lot because they included some fruits in it to make it sweet. Nice big chunks of Salmon but wish the portion was a bit bigger for 8. Lot of fruit in the fruit/salmon ratio. 

#3 The definite fav between me and my girlfriend. White Truffle Mac n Cheese. If you're into truffles. You might be tempted to order two (it's a title pricey at 5.xx) but there's a lot of cheese in there that fills you up. In hindsight wish we just got one scoop to share.

Comes with a complimentary price of bread. Was ok. Tried dipping it in the Mac n cheese LOL. Is ok.

Was about 20 a person for a protein two sides, and their lemonade.
author: Frank C.

description:
Not sure what the hype is about. The lemonade is so so though refills are only 1.50$.

The food is kind of pricey, I would recommend you eat at one of the restaurants on this same street vs eating some of these premade food that has been sitting on the counter for awhile
author: Cameron L.

description:
One and done. 
I decided to eat here because their veg options looked good. 
I tried four different salads. 
One hour later I got sick and stayed sick. 
I do not recommend eating here.
author: Dangerous T.

description: I avoided this spot for a while because it looked unappealing for whatever reason, but I'm glad I finally went in today! The food is yummy and tastes fresh, and both guys on staff were super friendly!
author: Sarah N.

description:
My BF and I really like Lemonade for the quality and consistency of food. It's super easy to pick up something healthy from Lemonade when we need a quick bite. The brussel sprouts are great, as is anything that is curried.

However, constructing a meal is super confusing. Our last trip, we wanted a plate of 4 marketplace salads. We chose our salads, and then were billed for 3 salads and an extra - which was about $5 more than we expected to pay (not a big deal, but that's also about a 40% larger tab than just the 4 salads.) Why? Because one of the salads (the "Chicken Apple SALAD", was not actually considered a salad by the cashier. What? Why on earth would you call something that is not considered a salad and place it right next to the salads, and then declare that we could choose any 4 salads?

The cashier was not helpful in the least. Like so many people in customer service jobs now, she just seemed indifferent. At that point, she said, there was nothing we could do because the food had already been delivered to us. Oh, and she also couldn't tell us where to find the prices of the plates. It felt like no one really cared about the user experience. That is, until I spoke with the manager Paolo.

Paolo is *awesome*. He completely redeemed our experience. We often lament how customer service has disappeared. Paolo made things right, and most of all, he made me feel listened to and validated.

Our experience was 1 star, but Paolo was 5 stars, so in the end, it averages out to about 3 stars. We'll probably go back, but I won't be recommending the chain to our friends - I'd hate for them to having a confusing/frustrating first experience just trying to get oriented to get food. And, if I ran anything that needed a customer liaison, I would run to Lemonade just to hire Paolo away.
author: Julie C.

description: My first time going to Lemonade because I heard they have good food. But I was disappointed. I waited for my sandwich for like 20 minutes even though they were not busy. My chips are very salty. My sandwich was okay. Too much lettuce on it. My drink lemonade the classic one didn't taste like lemonade at all. Too pricy for me. I could had gone to somewhere else. I won't be back here soon.
author: Jonjon M.

description: I got the bbq beef and the entire bowl was basically boxed mash potatoes, not sure but that's what it tasted like. The masked potatoes tasted like those potatoes you get dehydrated from the box. Not real potatoes. There were only 2 little pieces of beef, literally. And then some seasonal veggies and kale. Not a good dish, not for me, maybe other employees there will give you more meat if you ask. But I've gotten Lemonade in LA and in SF (at this location), and seemed like LA portions were better portioned.
author: Mary P.

description: This place serves quality ingredients at a reasonable price. The service is phenomenal and the tables are clean. I'm a fan of all the different sides you can order. Their poke bowls are fantastic, comparable to restaurants that specialize in poke! I would definitely recommend this place to all friends who want a quality and nutritious meal!
author: Jim G.

description:
They didn't have some of the meal combos like the other Lemonades around the Bay Area.  For example, they don't have the Big Chill, which is poke with 2 marketplace sides for $12. Here, you would have to buy the poke entree ($7.50) and then the 2 sides would have cost you $6.50 ($3.25 for each side). That would be $14 total where normally, one would get a price break in other Lemonades.

Quality of food is just about the same in my opinion, although I feel like they give slightly smaller portions than the other Lemonades I go to, which is the one in Burlingame and West Portal. 

The seating area is large and spacious. I love the pseudo outdoor/patio area where you can be under a roof but can open up the big windows to get fresh air.  The tables are clean and there is a lot of space.

One thing I was kinda shocked to see is they provide plastic forks and spoons. I thought this place, especially what it stands for, would for sure be one of those places that would provide you biodegradable utensils (corn starch utensils). Is that too much over thinking?
author: Jannie Q.

description: Lemonade can be a little pricey, but the quality of food and service is worth it! Love their white truffle mac n cheese - literally cannot stop eating it! I only tried their poke bowl as an entree, and it is surprisingly pretty tasty! I would get it again next time. All the servers were very friendly and accomodating. I love the decor and atmosphere of the place as well.
author: Priscilla L.

description: We were just passing by San Francisco and found this great recommendation for Lemonade. The food is delicious and unique. Th foos was a little expensive, but we liked how everything tasted so we were okay with the price.
author: Julie P.

description: My friend and I stopped by here on the way to the beach. There's wasn't a lot of people so we went through the line pretty fast. My friend got the 'choose 4 market place salads' and  I got a chef's plate with tender steak, truffle mac and cheese and mash potatoes. My friend and I pretty much just shared everything and was sooo good and fresh. I definitey recommend trying their truffle mac and cheese! The employees were super friendly and fast (great customer service) and the restaurant was really clean. Usually parking on Irving and surrounding streets is a pain in the ass but yesterday, we go pretty lucky and found a spot just around the corner from the the restaurant. Overall, great experience. No complaints! 5 stars!
author: Misty T.

description:
I am super happy a Lemonade decided to open in the inner sunset area!!! Now I don't have to go downtown if I have a craving (although the proximity to Yerba Buena Gardens there makes it delightful!). The food is really good and fresh here! love, love, love! 

The facility here just opened in June 2017 and is looking on point! Clean, spacious, helpful staff, and equally delicious choices in food! Menu's are located at the door and inside as well so you can review items you might like while on line. Nothing beats seeing your choices when you get up front though - and you can sample items if you're unsure of what you want to order. Everything seems more straight forward at this lemonade so I like it much better! I don't think this was offered in the one downtown, but there's a choice of 4 on marketplace items for $12.50. SO GOOD. I always go for the curried cauliflower - and this time opted for the avocado and tomatoes, kimchi soba noodles and pineapple chicken with green beans. You can get marketplace items a la carte too if you like. They also have sandwiches, hot dishes, sides, and of course plenty of options for lemonade. The roasted chicken looked soooo delicious and so did their sandwiches (although I did hear a couple next to me comment that wooly pig nearby had better sandwiches! I'll have to decide for myself!). 

All in all - I'm really glad it's here and I hope they keep everything up!
author: Deanna S.

description: I ended up ordering the strawberry rhubarb lemonade($3.50), butternut squash salad ($3.25), and truffle mac'n cheese ($4.95). The food was good and the lemonade was refreshing. Portion size aka the scoop depends on the employee giving it to you. I noticed how inconsistent the scoops were. A very once in a while treat for me.
author: Wesley K.

description:
Great addition to the neighborhood!  Came here today with my girlfriend and we each had one of the 4 item plates so we could sample everything.  Everything was incredibly fresh and flavorful, while portion sizes were plentiful.  I loved that my mint cucumber lemonade wasn't overly sweet as well, but instead nicely balanced.  The staff were all incredibly nice and professional, while the space has a great vibe about it (outside of the lowlifes out front that are getting paid to protest, but it's not like Lemonade can do anything about that).

I foresee us popping down here often in the future when we're looking for a quick, affordable, healthy meal.  Welcome to the neighborhood Lemonade.
author: Joshua W.

description:
Worth a visit just for their moniker, the tasty lemonade in both a slush or standard format. Multiple flavors to meet your sweet needs.
As for the food, pre-made items that you select and create a meal plate. From sides to main dish, a variety to meet your American food needs. Food was good but not enough for me to want to go back a second time.
author: David H.

description:
I'm always on the lookout for healthy, quick spots like Lemonade, and was looking forward to trying this new location. The variety of options and service didn't disappoint! The people were friendly and made sure I knew that everything was available to sample.

I got a protein plate with chicken, mac and cheese, and the harissa cauliflower. Everything was tasty, but the portion was a bit on the small side and for $13+, I expected a bit more. Perhaps I'll go with the salad options next time.
author: Tim X.

description: So good! We tried the blood orange lemonade with a warmed up cookie. Will be back to try the watermelon one!
author: Hanan B.

description:
We ordered from Lemonade for takeout and it was underwhelming.

I chose mac n cheese, the pinapple chicken with green beans, and the grilled chicken breast. The mac n cheese was warm but little flavor, and the pasta was very soft/mushy. The pineapple chicken had good flavor, but the chicken seemed like maybe it was part its prime? Everything just fell short in one way or another. The flavor was ok but not what I was expecting considering the pictures looked amazing!

The strawberry rhubarb lemonade was the best part of the meal!
Probably will not try again.
author: Larissa S.

description: My first and last time trying Lemonade. Got my turkey avocado pesto aioli sandwich and tomato soup to-go. Soup wasn't sealed properly so it spilled when I try to take it out of the paper bag (imagine the disaster with tomato soup). The rest that was left I had to drink it out of the bowl because they gave me two forks. The sandwich was cold and everything slid out because the thick wrapping paper was so big I couldn't use it to wrap my sandwich and eat it at the same time. I ended up eating my sandwich separately - ingredients then bread. Truly a MESS and unenjoyable meal for $18. Ironically, the two forks came in handy so I don't have to use my fingers to feed myself. But seriously, do yourself a favor and find another sandwich shop.
author: Jennifer F.

description: Jet is amazing and super helpful!! After a loooooooong day at work, my boyfriend and I were def not looking forward to going home to cook so he mentioned that he wanted to go to Lemonade and lucky us cuz Jet def helped turn a long drawn out day to a wonderfully pleasant dinner experience. He was patient with our browsing of their amazing selection of hot and cold foods, and very intuitive with his recommendations. From the bottom of our hearts and full stomachs, we want to thank Jet for making our evening... and on a Monday too!
author: Emmeline L.

description:
Had Caviar deliver some Lemonade food and was quite impressed! Packaging was nice and neat. I thought the portions were small, but my eyes were just deceiving me - it turned out to be plenty. I really liked the ahi tuna with avo and mandarin. So fresh. Next time I'll eat it with some crackers. 

The steak and chimichuri was pretty good. Not overdone but would rather it have been slightly pinker. But it was tender and tasty. And chimichuri was GREAT. 

Truffle Mac & cheese was also very moist and tasty! Good job, Lemonade!
author: Whitney M.

description: Ordered the red miso braised short ribs with rice. It was a good meal but for the price I definitely don't think it was worth it.
author: AGawesomeness6 ..

description: This place is awesome! They have an excellent array of inventive and tasty salads. Highly recommend the pineapple, chicken, and green bean salad. I got the 4 salad plate with a watermelon rosemary lemonade and ended up taking about a third of it home. Very reasonably priced considering the quality and variety of salads. It runs about the same as a meal at Panera's.
author: Arianna C.

description:
TLDR; bright, new, but still bland food.

One of the nicer atmospheres in the sunset area. Vibrant, bright and clean space. Really friendly staff that smile from beginning to end. Unfortunately, the food is sub par. 

Lemonade often feels like a bait-and-switch with their fancy stores and mediocre taste, and this location is no exception. The Inner Sunset's restaurants are unique because they are low key, grungy, and ultimately delicious. Lemonade stands out from the pack, but blending in would have probably been a better strategy. Restaurants are food first and until this is true for Lemonade, they will never get as far as they desire. 

I will come back in a few months to see if the food has improved. Best of luck!
author: James S.

description:
Just skip this place, y'all. 

This is one of a handful of restaurants trying to gentrify this neighborhood with their bland, overpriced food. 

If you're a fan of mediocre cafeteria food for some reason, this is for you. Otherwise, there's TONS of better, tastier, cheaper local restaurants on this very block.
author: Gautham S.

description:
The worst location of the three I've visited, which are Irving, downtown and West Portal. The Downtown and West Portal locations tasted so much better and the workers were more competent.

It was 2:30pm on a Saturday afternoon and hardly anyone there. There was a party of three in front of me and a lady was helping them get their orders. I waited five minutes and I saw at least five people working. Not sure what they were doing.

Finally someone took my order. I had to repeat my order of Chicken Sandwich with orecchiette pest pasta salad and Chicken Breast entree with truffle mac n cheese and mashed potatoes twice to him. It's weird. He'd partially input one order and then ask me what I ordered again. Fine - maybe he's new to the job. He asked me what sauce I wanted with my chicken and I said chimichurri after he listed the options.

I grabbed by number and proceeded to pay at the cashier where I ordered a blood orange lemonade and frozen lemonade. I took my drinks and waited at a booth for my food.

Five minutes later, the cashier shows up with one box with the chicken sandwich and asked what else I ordered. I said the chicken entree and she replied that it'd be a few more minutes.

Five more minutes later, the guy who took my order came by and asked what else I ordered. Seriously? Can't you guys look at my receipt? I said that I'm waiting for my chicken entree and he replied with mash and mac n cheese? Nodding because he was so proud he remembered. Then replies with, "It's going to take a little longer because they're making it. Like ten more minutes."

Seriously?! Why the f did you not tell me that when I ordered from you after waiting five minutes to be serviced? My frozen lemonade is no longer frozen and my sandwich is no longer warm. I thought this was a grab and go type of place. Instead I've been here 15-20 minutes waiting for "fast food."

To top it off, I brought my food home and noticed that I didn't get a "baked crisp." Not sure what it is but considering I paid $37 for food, I'd like to get what I'm supposed to get. Additionally, I never got my chimichurri and he gave me balsamic sauce for the super dry chicken. So disappointing. If I got this kind of treatment with bad food, imagine how bad this place would be during a rush. No thank you. I rather go somewhere else or drive to West Portal.
author: Remus L.

description:
My partner and I stumbled across this place as we left from Golden Gate Park and without looking at yelps ratings and reviews, we decided to take a chance. As it was our first time paying a visit to the Lemonade chain, we found it difficult to order but thankfully the Lemonade staff was beyond friendly and was able to help us order something based on what we were in the mood for. Both my partner and I ordered the herb grilled chicken sandwich and despite the delectable images on the menu, there were two major problems with our sandwiches. 

1. The combined price for a cup of lemonade, a cup/side of macaroni, and the sandwich came out to a little over $22.00! Since I was practically starving and refused to go through the already complicated ordering process, I gave the cashier my card :-( In my opinion, this seemed very pricey compared to the other delicious food places within the sunset area but nevertheless, I was excited to try something new.

2. After purchasing my meal, I was told that it would take an additional 10 minutes to prepare my food over the fact that there was no available cooked chicken. Although upsetting, I kept my hopes up. When the food arrived about 13 minutes later, I was completely unimpressed with both the taste and presentation. As with the rest of the reviews on yelp, the sandwich was not only bland in taste but also was mushy in its texture. The chicken was soft and slippery, leaving my partner to mistake the  chicken for egg whites and the mozzarella for jello. We were both unimpressed with both the food and the price and will most likely not return. 

On the plus side, Lemonade's staff was extremely friendly and knowledgable about their menu down to the ingredient. Its refreshing design was more than inviting and their $4 blood orange lemonade was impressive. Until Lemonade improves their awfully bland taste and texture, which seem to be something that they are infamous for, I will not be making a second visit anytime soon.
author: Isaiah W.

description:
I used to eat here at least once a week and I would always get the chef's plate with chicken. Unfortunately, it is a hit or miss. It seems like they keep on changing the way they cook the food. First time I had the chicken it was flavorful and moist. I don't know what happened but after that, it's now always dry to the point that it's hard to swallow it. As for the sides, one constant side that I would always get is the roasted brussel sprouts but then it happened again and they cooked it differently that it just tasted sugary and raw. Ew. I just wasted money and didn't even finish my meal. I had the truffle mac n cheese once and that was quite good. I just wish the cooking of the food would be more consistent. Quality control people!! 


If you decide to eat here, always ask to sample it first.
author: Dianne P.

description:
This place is disappointing. There are other Lemonade locations that are great, and I have nothing against this chain. I even had high hopes for this location--the owner came to the neighborhood two years ago (when seeking a permit to open this location) just to show the area what they can do. The three stars are only because I know what this company is capable of doing. 

But this location has never lived up to that reputation. The service is "eh," it's super slow, and the food is consistently "meh." Shoot, last time I stopped by I ordered a chicken sandwich. They forgot to put on the chicken. This location needs some TLC from corporate.
author: Jon L.

description:
Let me preface this by saying that I hate giving bad reviews. I believe this is my first.

Came to this branch after having a positive experience at the Burlingame location. When I ordered there was only one person in front of me. I got a Chef's plate with steak and an order of chicken a la carte. After I paid, staff asked me if I would want to change my order to steak because chicken would take an extra five minutes while it finishes cooking. I said I can wait. Staff told me they would bring the food to me. I sat directly in front of the register to make it easier. A rush of about 7-10 people came in. At this time, one of the chefs took out a tray of chicken. I anticipated getting my food momentarily.

After 20 mins, I went up to the counter to follow up. I expressed empathy knowing they were busy, however I was told 5 minutes--I did not expect to wait this long. Staff took my receipt and went to check on my order. Staff said, "I'm sorry we ran out of chicken but I'll make sure it comes out right away". This came on the heels of me seeing all of the chicken that was just brought out be served to patrons that came after me. I asked her if they served all of the chicken that was brought out and was not able to get a straight answer. 

I waited for another 10 minutes before I just asked for another order of steak instead. The staff then asked me what my order was again. Are you kidding?! That was just incompetence in my opinion. At the very minimum, I wish they would have owned up to their mistake and told me they forgot my order and begin to try to make it right. The least one can do is offer me a lemonade while I wait perhaps? I don't know. I ended up getting one order of hot steak, one order of cold steak, a decent tasting side of green beans and some arugula. His place only gets two stars because I feel like one star restaurant's are reserved for places with racists maybe. But this experience was terrible and I'm reluctant to try again.

P.S. to add insult to injury, the banner says "hello, San Fran" ...did these LA PR people not do enough market research to know no one says "San Fran"?
author: Rob C.

description:
I wanted to like this place so bad and, they make some amazing lemonade. But, they should probably just stick with that. I ordered a grilled cheese & steak sandwich which, oddly, took longer to make than it does to buy the ingredients at the grocery. While the presentation and ambiance is nice, I have had better grilled cheese sandwiches from food trucks. How do you make a sub-par grilled cheese?!?  

I will still try it again in the hopes the wait time is reduced and the quality of food improves. But, if it doesn't, at least I know where to grab a thirst quenching lemonade.
author: Michael B.

description:
Ordered delivery and it was delayed an hour. No response by the restaurant. Terrible service.

The food is so so. Not sure why it was taking so long when it's all pre-done quick salads and sandwiches.

Terrible.
author: S. C.

description:
I recently had lunch at this location of Lemonade. Upon entry, the place looked big and clean. There was no line, a plus. There were many food options, another plus. So why only two stars? 

1. Bad service

About five minutes after we ordered, an employee came over with the bf's plate.  He set it down and grabbed our number so I thought he would be right back with my food. 

Five minutes later, still no sight of my food so I go up to inquire. The same employee who helped us with our order was ringing up a family. Ten minutes later, he's still helping them without any acknowledgment of my presence. 

Finally, he finishes up and asks me what I want to order. I tell him it's been over 15 minutes and I still haven't gotten my food. He goes and looks at the sandwiches waiting to be plated, returns to confirm my order, then goes back and looks at the sandwiches packed in takeout boxes. Turned out my sandwich had been chilling on the counter in a takeout box.

2. Mediocre food, small portions.

I liked the spicy jalapeno kick of the roasted chicken sandwich ("the San Diego way") but the portion was small for $12 with only four tiny pieces of chicken. The menu said it came with avocado but there wasn't any in my sandwich. The tomato and pasta salad was ok, but the chips were mostly crumbs.

The bf had the roasted chicken breast with mashed potatoes and veggie chili ($13). He said the chicken wasn't terrible but a bit overcooked and lacking flavor. It came with balsamic chicken jus on the side which was fine. The chili was basic and the mashed potatoes was fine. He considered it a light lunch in terms of the amount of food.

I would've liked to add Lemonade to my list of go-to food places in the area, but overall, the various issues left a sour taste in my mouth that doesn't make me want to return any time soon.
author: Venna L.

description:
The cafeteria from hell.
If your looking for a cafeteria that caters specifically to wealthy anorexics, this is your spot. With painfully vacant smiles that may have you so creeped out you'll shiver, the staff will assure you not to worry, this is indeed the tiny portion size you spent 20 dollars on. I'll keep my money for the boy with the stand on the street. The real lemonade, that tastes great and has you paying just right.
author: Austin S.

description: Love this place. This is my go-to place to get food when I'm in a hurry or just want something healthy and filling. I highly recommend their butternut squash with white corn and corn nuts and any of their brussel sprouts. Their butternut squash has a nice spicy kick to it but not too spicy since the white corn helps balance it out and the corn nuts gives this dish a crunch (which I love!).
author: Joanne K.

description: The lemonade is super refreshing. Sweet enough to quench your thirst. I didn't try any of their food options. The place is also super nice and lots of sitting. If you're around the area, definitely worth stopping by for some lemonade
author: Antonella H.

description: Stopped inside with the boyfriend after a nice walk, wanted to get something to drink. One of the employees noticed we looked a bit lost and greeted us and asked if it was our first time and if we needed any help. We told him we just wanted to get some lemonade. He told us that we were welcome to sample any of the flavors, we tried cucumber mint, watermelon rosemary and blood orange. All the flavors were very good, we opted for the blood orange. Super refreshing for our walk back home. We are looking forward to coming back to try out their food menu and more lemonade!
author: Lily S.

description:
I suspect my kids like the place because they like to say "lemonade."  I like the place because of the location and the space.  But I didn't realize how much I missed La Boulange until Lemonade replaced it.  

Food-wise, there is really nothing super special about Lemonade.  The salads came in a variety of choices, but all too salty.  The lemonade itself is fine, but then again, it's a drink that you can make and perfect at home.
author: Candice B.

description:
I live above this restaurant so I was really really hoping it would be good. Unfortunately, most of their fare is relatively uninspired and bland. The steak I got was incredibly chewy.

I wish they were open for breakfast or brunch (they have SO MUCH seating!)

It never really seems busy, which is a worrying sign for a new restaurant. I just don't see them making it unless they open earlier or get some tastier options.
author: Steven J.

description: This is review number 1 billion recommending this place.   Just go already.   It's amazing.  It's fantastic fresh food.  And if you bring your vegan friend, they will love it too.
author: Patrick O.

description:
The food was great! Loved the team they explained how everything worked and made excellent recommendations! 

Got the chicken pot pie, mashed potatoes, and the pesto pasta salad! The blood orange lemonade was so good!
author: Michael O.

description: Really overpriced. The menu is all over the place and the savory dishes all taste too sweet - like someone poured lemonade into all of them. Stars are for the cleanliness and service.
author: C. Marie W.

description: I cannot speak on the food but the old-fashioned lemonade is refreshing! Definitely recommend on a warm day if you're in the area
author: Mohamed A.

description:
Just left and sat down to eat my food. They were out of all entrees but steak so I got steak. The steak I'm looking at is 40% fat. 
They were out of most sides and every one of the ones I asked for had an extra charge of like 2 bucks so I was finally like just give me whatever you have that you  think is good that won't cost extra.
They were out of all lemonades but two at a place called lemonade.
author: Conor F.

description:
I am glad we stop by here for lunch . The food looks really healthy and love the restaurant . It is very clean and love the seating . They even have outside sitting too . 

I order the chicken sandwich with salad on the side . It was really good , light and yummy . I felt that I ate a healthy lunch . 

I also brought the peach ginger lemonade and it is really good . It was very refreshing and I love the drink
author: Isabelle L.

description:
I called in my to go order at 1:30 and left with my food at 2:20. After all that waiting, I asked why it was taking so long and she said it was because of the lunch rush..but there were no more than 10 people in the restaurant with zero people in line. Oh and it was past 2pm.

UPDATE: The manager reached out and made up for this poor service.
author: Evan V.

description: Bland, lukewarm food that tasted way past its prime. It's almost as if everything was made the day before and then just re-heated today. Everything sort of the same mushy texture. Portions were small for the price. If it's going to be low quality and expensive it better at least fill me up. Hard pass going forward.
author: Ross R.

description:
The food was pretty tasty, but I thought it was kind of pricey, especially for fast pre-made food.   I got the 4-salad combo and the truffle mac and cheese. The portion size was adequate and filling, but it might not be enough for someone with a bigger appetite. I really liked the New Mexican chili roasted butter squash with corn and the wild rice with lentils. The peach ginger lemonade was nice too. 

The food was tasty, but it did not leave me with a big impression enough for me to remember to come back. For that price, I'd prefer to go to a sit-down restaurant instead. There are so many delicious sit-down options around this area that costs around the same price or less.
author: Annie L.

description: I came here for lunch today around 12:30 and was so surprised the place was empty. There only 3 sitting customers. I thought that was odd cause with all the hype and all I was expecting to wait in line especially in a heat like today; you would think that people will be pouring in at least for the lemonade. But no. I came here because there was a long line at Arizmendi. I wonder why this place seems empty most of the time even on weekends. My gym is just at the opposite site of this restaurant so I pass by it often. I got the 4 combo salad to go. The container is tiny for a $12 salad. I could easily get the same size salad from Trader Joe's for $2.99 . So I'm wondering if that's one of the reasons this place doesn't have many customers. I also got classic lemonade. All together cost me $17. They gave me little discount for being UCSF employee. But for me, that's just too expensive for a lunch, I could get 2 slices of pizza from Arizmendi and smoothie from Jamba Juice for less than $12. Lemonade Definitely expensive, especially knowing that their food are pre-prep. I'll go to Marnee Thai instead. Sorry Lemonade. I probably won't go back.
author: Jas L.

description: I...had such high hopes for this place based on my undying and deep affection for juice as a fine beverage category and a seemingly healthy menu. But...*opens mouth* *closes mouth* my steak sandwich took 20 minutes to emerge from the kitchen and was mediocre at best. It was fine. It was ok. I wouldn't write it a love letter or go out of my way to come here again. Was there mayo on my broccoli? I'm not sure, but that tangy flavor was unwelcome. I am rooting for this place to live up to its potential. Lemonade: come for the Lemonade. Leave after you order a Lemonade. Then give it to me and order you own. Mmmm the lemonade though.
author: Newlyswedish S.

description: This is the 3rd time I've been here since it opened and I hoped that it would have improved but No! Always wait 15+ minutes for my food, the people working seem to be confused with how things should work and the pricing is insane. Done giving it a try :(
author: Amy S.

description: I've been to the Lemonade at Yerba Buena Gardens and my first time at this location. YB is better.  My max and cheese was cold, perhaps because it took two cashiers to assist a family and I had to wait.  The food was good though.  But someone please tell me why they are always out of forks?????  Second time in two locations.  Had to use a plastic one which isn't good for good environment.  Think about putting some heat in this location.  It's the Sunset and it's cold in here.
author: Felicia V.

description: Decided to grab an a la carte chicken mozzarella sandwich along with a frozen lemonade for lunch today (September 26, 2017) around 1:00 pm.  The amount of skin and grizzle which I removed reduced the sandwich by around 1/3.  $8 + for the sandwich and one of their frozen drinks brought the tab to close to $16.00.  They assigned me a number flag (13) and then waited for almost ten minutes to pay.  They only had one register open, with one person and a couple ahead of me.  They brought me my sandwich while I was still awaiting checkout.  This place needs some tender loving guidance on basic restaurant practices.  The next time I do my daily hike/walk I will bring along a sandwich from home to eat in the park.  I never Yelp, but I had to in this instance.
author: Chloe C.

description: Wow this was the most disappointing poke bowl I've ever had in my life. The salmon looked really old  and mushy, so I opted for the tuna. When the girl went to put the rice in, she failed to ask me whether I wanted white or brown rice. I called out to her to ask for brown rice, but she said they ran out. I wish she would've mentioned it being out but it's fine. I asked her for soba noodles, as I did not feel like having rice so I guess that was nice of her. Then she told me that they ran out of wakame salad and asked if I would like to have the furikake, ginger, or fried garlic to replace. Again, she knew there was no wakame but didn't mention that beforehand. If I had known that, I could have gotten something else than a sub par poke bowl with half of what I wanted. Now when I actually ate the food - I was surprised by how mushy the soba noodles were. They literally broke as I put my fork into the bowl. It was really close to the consistency of baby food... and the poke itself was fine, but it barely had any tuna in it. I had only 5 pieces, and the rest was mostly mandarin orange and oranges. I can't believe I paid $12 for this... I would not recommend this place at all
author: Ashley T.

description: I had heard so many positive things about their l.a locations but unfortunately this location was very underwhelming! The soup I had was SOO salty, all the salads tasted the same, and it was so expensive I just can't imagine spending that much again for that food. Nothing I had was satisfying. I also hate how they do the ordering "so u want the farmers market plate " - I don't know lady I just want those two things like why does it need a name
author: Linda G.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Lemonade locations in Los Angeles.  Unfortunately I think this location has some execution issues that management really needs to work on.  

First, 30-40% of the prepared salads weren't available.  I was told if I waited 15-20 minutes they'd have the next batch made.  Not acceptable at a place like this.  They need to fine tune processes to make sure there are basically never any outages.  That should be simple.

Second, when I ordered sandwiches, it took around 15 minutes for the first one to come out and 25 minutes for the second.  It was late in the day, the crowd was light, and there was a huge number of employees in the back doing god knows what.  Not acceptable to take this long.

Finally, the sandwiches we got were made poorly.  They were drenched in aioli - we went through probably 15 napkins.  They also left huge chunks of pure skin/fat on the chicken - not the good crispy skin you might actually want to eat.  Not acceptable.

I'm not giving this a one star only because the food wasn't terrible.  It wasn't very good to be clear, but it was far from inedible.

So attention Lemonade corporate management: fly up more trainers from LA.  Your employees don't know what they are doing or your managers aren't managing well.  Course correction needed.
author: Kevin G.

description:
Healthy options and you can choose multiple items in different sizes.  Figuring out what to order is a bit confusing at first, but i'm sure i'll get used to it.
For example, the Chef's Plate allows you to get a protein, like steak, and then you also choose two Sides or Marketplace Salads for $13.  Some of the sides cost a bit extra, like the Poke.  The poke was really tasty though.  It seems with tax, you'll probably spend up to $16, or $20 if you upgrade your salad to something like poke.
author: J B.

description: Great food there except the fact that I've found a piece of elastic in my poke bowl. Not sure that was supposed to be in there. Would have maybe preferred if the poke bowl was done a bit more neatly than just throwing the ingredients in a plastic bowl...
author: William L.

description:
The food's pretty good. Portions are a little small for the price, but acceptable. My biggest con is that the employees need to try a little harder to keep the place clean. There was barely anyone there when I went the other evening, but half of the tables had random food left on them and/or were "wiped clean" with grease smeared all over them. Meanwhile, several employees were standing around in the back chatting away.

I hope they can work through the kinks and stick around for the long term, because having Lemonade here is a way better option than having this space sitting vacant again.
author: John G.

description: The menu is unconventional, but very flexible. Had the chef's plate with steak, a salad and fried cauliflower. The steak was cold, thin, and completely flavorless. The sides had slightly more flavor, but were also tiny. $12 will get you a better meal at almost any restaurant in the Sunset. The only redeeming quality was the large and delightfully chewy chocolate chip cookie, but that wasn't enough to make me want to go back.
author: Zach K.

description: These prices and I have to clear my own table?! Is this a fast food place? Because at least I expect that at McDonald's. There are dozens of decent restaurants in the neighborhood with table service, lower prices and I don't have to do bus girl duty. We ordered 5 dishes and most of the food was cold after the 30 minutes it took to complete everything. Total: over $78!! I ordered an entree, was told the noodles weren't available, after a 10 minute wait, and was offered rice. OK. When I started eating, I realized I had been given a completely different entree. Too upset and frustrated to complain. One person serves one customer at a time, including filling the beverage order and ringing up the check. If there was an actual crowd - we were the only customers - they would be totally unprepared. Food bland and overpriced. Not fresh. Understaffed. Are these company owned locations or franchised? Someone needs to step up and correct these huge problems, noted in the reviews. First time. Never, ever again.
author: Sue R.

description: I paid $14 for their "market salad" which is 4 sides. The container they put all the 4 sides was less than an inch deep. TINIEST portions. Food is good but complete rip off.
author: Brian L.

description: First time trying lemonade since the store open few weeks ago, fancy store inside and outside. Bought 3 lemonade drinks (watermelon, bloody marry and cucumber flavor) on the super sunny hot day, thought the lemonade could cool us down but these three drinks taste plain, not enough flavor. I am sorry to say they taste like a water, guess won't coming back.
author: Jasper K.

description: Love this place!Danny was super friendly checking in on us to ger feedback.  Quick great tasting choices. It is cafeteria style. You get to choose from different salads or meat dishes. Like the best potluck you have ever been to. They even let you sample salads so you can make best choice. Love the date brussel sprouts! Others my group chose salmon mashed potatoes. Everyone had the meal they wanted. Very nice for vegetarians and meat eaters.
author: Kimberly K.

description: I absolutely love this place. Whenever I'm in the neighborhood I HAVE to stop in. The food is fresh and so delicious. The staff is super kind and helpful. Plus there's WiFi and large tables so I can get some work done while having an awesome and healthy meal.
author: Juliana R.

description:
Food was extraordinarily "meh," and pretty overpriced for what it was. They don't offer ANY veggie protein options, so anyone who doesn't eat meat has to survive on overpriced sides, most of which are cold. Since the location is new, I'll cut them a break, but they all seem to be totally confused on how their own buffet system works. 

Go to Plutos around the corner for better food at a better price. 

Boyfriend chimes in and says, "the poke was awful and had tangerines in it for some reason, along with a gross aioli sauce."
author: Stefanie G.

description: First time eating here. My sister from USF recommended this place. The food here is really good and I got the green tea lemonade. Plenty of seating inside. Great place for family, and friends.
author: N K.

description: Amazing service. The workers were always trying to be enthusiastic and ongoing. The food is great, they gave us a free slice of cake and it was delicious. One of the best places I've been to.
author: VackaPlays_YT ..

description: Stopped by on a sunday afternoon. This was my first time to this location. Overall I found it very disappointing. CONS: More than 5 dishes needed refilled with a 20 minute wait for them. Staff was un-knowledgeable. Food was poorly made and honestly tasted gross. PROS: Location was very clean. There was ample space and seating wasn't a problem.  Bathrooms were tidy.
author: Brian P.

description: I was really looking forward to Lemonade opening up in our neighborhood.  I think the concept is great.  Unfortunately, it was a complete disappointment.  The first time I went there I got the chicken breast, tomato avocado salad and the chopped salad.  The 2 salads were soooo salty I couldn't even eat them.  The chicken breast was good and not dried out.  My husband wanted to try it again and I had the same experience.  Vegetable chili was salty, brussell sprouts were salty, but the chicken breast was good.  Way too salty!! The staff there are very nice but that's not enough for me to go back.
author: Amy C.

description: Best Lemonade thus far. I have been to severals in the Bay Area and nothing compares to the costumer service and great food portion they provide at this location. Shayna helped me out and she was very nice! I will defiantly come back!
author: Kevin A.

description:
I had a completely different experience dining at this location than I had at the Lemonade on Mission. The service was much less friendly and disorganized. The salad selections included many empty dishes. We were told "The tomato avocado salad won't be out for at least 20 minutes." and "The avocado poke is really popular so it goes fast.". We did not come in near to closing time, so I wonder whether or not they were trying to clear the other salads and didn't want to prepare new batches of the "popular" foods.

The wait to receive our food was really long. When we finally received our meals, we were even less impressed. We ordered the "tender" steak and the "seared" ahi both which carry an additional charge above the $13 cited in giant numbers at the top of the menu board.

The steak and the ahi were both tough and loaded with sinew. The worst of the meal was the SALT overloaded on everything. The mashed potatoes were inedible due to the excessive salt and the macaroni was not far behind. The cauliflower salad was okay, but not nearly as good as it is at the Mission Street location. The lemonade was yummy though.

I am sad to say that with so many more affordable dining choices in the neighborhood, I will probably not return to this Lemonade location unless I am simply thirsty.
author: Rebecca H.

description: I live in the neighborhood and wasn't thrilled about the new addition, but was optimistic about having a healthy takeout option. My sister was in town and wanted to try it, so she ordered the plate with chicken, mac n cheese (regular), and tortilla soup. The staff was super helpful--my sister asked what was in the tortilla soup and the girl brought out a book and read off the ingredients, and then poured a little taster cup for her. I wasn't hungry, but got a blood orange lemonade. It was absolutely delicious, and I still can't stop raving about it. My sister said the food was just OK--the tortilla soup was too salty for her to eat and she said the mac and cheese was disappointing. She also mentioned how pricey it came out to be--close to $20 for a 3-item plate plus a lemonade. We probably won't be back for the food, but definitely would stop in again for a drink.
author: Emily W.

description: My family & I came in for lunch because we recognized Lemonade from LA. We go to the Studio city location ALL THE TIME, & we were extremely excited to go somewhere on vacation that we knew we would really like. Per usual, the staff was extremely helpful & it was just as bright and welcoming as it always is. We love Lemonade because of the consistency we get at every restaurant. I had the steak!! SO tender!!! The truffle mac, obviously, was amazing. Daniel offered us a sample of the new frozen lemonade that you all have & it is delicious!!!!! We met a lovely manager named Deanna, she came to our table to make sure we were okay & check in on us. She was really sweet & attentive. Thanks Lemonade San Francisco!! See you again soon!
author: Nikki F.

description: I'm surprised by all of the so-so reviews. I took my sister, two-year-old niece, and my sister's friend here today and we were blown away. I've never been to another location to compare but I think the concept is awesome. Everything was clean and the food was amazing. They let us have as many samples as we wanted, too. Very friendly staff. At around $50 for 3 adults and a 2-year-old (she had a side of mac & cheese) + the quality/healthy factor of the food... I'm super sold! I can't wait to go back! My husband and I are going to be on parental leave soon and I can see us coming here for weekday lunches to get out of the house and will definitely take people here when they visit us (especially friends/family with kids). One of the employees even came around and gave my niece a side of mashed potatoes. Super sweet and she ate them all up. Two different employees also came around to ask how we were enjoying everything and I totally appreciate that kind of customer service. And that frozen lemonade! I wish I had some right now.
author: Melissa N.

description: I really wanted to like this place. I've been twice and both times the food just tastes like nothing.....there's no flavor.
author: Alexandra F.

description: Tried a few times because of the convenient location, but the food is overpriced, unoriginal, and far from fresh. Soggy, over-dressed, wilting salads, oily potatoes, fatty meat, and the worst poke out of 5 spots in a three-block radius. I'm also bothered by a restaurant that touts its healthiness but mostly serves macaroni and desserts. Wish this was more like Native or Café Gratitude, but you'll find neither tasty nor nutritious options here.
author: Kate E.

description:
I will preface the review by saying that I have enjoyed eating at Lemonade restaurants in Los Angeles for the past several years - I have probably been close to two dozen times at multiple locations, and have always had wonderful experiences (which is why I have continued to go back).  I was incredibly excited when Lemonade opened in SF - and it's really disappointing that the experience just isn't the same as LA. 

I have eaten at the downtown SF and Portola locations before - they have been just okay.  Today I tried the brand new one and had just a terrible experience.  While the SF restaurants look the same and overlap in terms of the menu, the quality just isn't the same - and the operations need huge improvement.  This location is new, so certainly some growing pains - I just hope the folks looking to build a consistent experience and brand recognize that their operations in SF do not match the great restaurant they have built in LA.  A quick scan of Yelp reviews reflects the discrepancy in customer experience.

Specific feedback regarding my lunch today in the Inner Sunset:
- Operations are clearly problematic.  The restaurant was half full and the line snaked out the door with it taking several minutes to move people along through the ordering process.  They didn't have enough people working - and there was confusion amongst the staff as to who was supposed to help who  
- The multiple stations laid out weren't clear to people.  Customers who wanted sandwiches/salads were standing in the cold prepared salad station, and then waited in line for the people who were served cold salads to eventually pay.  When they reached their hot station it just clogged the line they then blocked the people who had cold salads waiting to pay (which blocked people from ordering cold salads)
- They ran out of many things on the menu. About half of the cold salads were not available.  We instead tried to order the roast chicken - but that too was sold out.  Eventually I ordered the tuna and it was served without a "crisp" (aka toasted bread).  I was told at the cash register that they were out of that too
- The food quality is bad - not anywhere close to what is prepared in LA.  The tuna I had was stringy - impossible to cut through, and required pulling the meat from the natural texture in the fish which resembled thick dental floss.  Pretty nasty.  The broccoli with riccota salata wasn't as fresh or tasty as what I eat in LA, and had much less cheese.  My wife's chicken thigh was grizzly and not super tasty.  Her cold salads also didn't taste like what we remember enjoying
- Selection is not the same in SF.  There are fewer prepared salads available.  Additionally, they are always the same ones.  In Los Angeles they always seem to offer different salads, including special and seasonal ones.  Here it's the same selection every time - no seasonality
- Pricing is weird.  No longer do they have the pick 2,3 or 4 salads, instead encouraging you to buy the 4 salad plate.  I think the intention was to simplify the menu through offering fewer choices - but it ends up being more confusing as there are so many options if you want to mix and match along the way, with the ability to do so and pricing being unclear
- A small point, but for whatever reason there is a $4.25 markup per serving for ordering the Tuna & Avocado Poke as part of your 4 salad combo.  That's on top of the $12.50 for 4 salads.  So if you wanted one order of Tuna poke, it would cost $16.75 for the plate.  And say you wanted 4 scoops of the tuna, it would cost $29.50. This seems bizarre
- Service was well intentioned - the staff did their best working through the obvious operational challenges.  

I feel bad giving this review as I have historically been a huge advocate for the restaurant.  Not only have I continued to frequent the Los Angeles locations when I have been in town, but I was incredibly excited at their opening in SF.  I have tried the SF restaurants several times - they have all been disappointing, but borderline acceptable where I have remained hope that they would eventually get better.  Today it's clear that things have unfortunately gone downhill and I can no longer assume it's the same as Lemonade Los Angeles.

I hope things improve improve to the experience at their Los Angeles restaurants.
author: Daniel W.

description: We were excited to try this place with the family and were very disappointed with the non stroller friendly layout of the place. We couldn't maneuver our (very small) stroller to get food and sit and to top it off there were NO changing tables. Pretty shocking for an inner sunset restaurant with new construction. We ended up going to Park Chow instead.
author: Karen P.

description: I love this place and wish they had one in Denver. We came here for lunch and everything was amazing - very fresh, healthy and delicious. You basically get a plate and they can fill it with as many or few things as you want. I had a salad with avocado and heirloom tomatoes, and a cold asian noodle salad. Both were amazing. I think my husband got a lunch sandwich with cheese and steak. He liked his a lot too. I miss their food so much I'm thinking about buying their cookbook.
author: Y G.

description: I'm not one to write bad reviews, however, this is an exceptional case. Let me just say the customer service was phenomenal, but it ends there. After eating the chicken mozzarella sandwich and a butternut squash side, I immediately felt sick to my stomach. I hoped it would pass but it kept getting worse, and by the time I got home, I had thrown up everything in my stomach. I don't know what was wrong with the meal but my friend ordered the same sandwich and also felt sick. I hope it was just the sandwich, but I probably won't be back.
author: Neela F.

description: we had the same disappointing experience as former reviewer, brian l.  we found the food too salty and not a value at all.  i try to embrace changes in the neighborhood, but this particular corporate cafeteria is overshadowed by the other wonderful choices available in the surrounding blocks.
author: Alexandria B.

description: This is a great place to go to if your feeling like going somewhere fancy, but not too fancy. They have great sandwiches, and salads. Their steak could have been a bit more cooked, but overall, it was a great meal
author: Nima A.

description: I'm in SF for Outside Lands. I've been to Lemonade in Venice and Beverly, both solid locations. I usually make a point of hitting local joints when traveling but was stocked when I saw a familiar name. This is a "10.0" Lemonade so they didn't have the Louie salad I like. In Beverly this can be made into a sandwich, so I was a little thrown off by the different layout. The plus is that in its place they have hot proteins Tender Greens style. I was bummed the tuna was served cold though advertised as a hot item, I mentioned this, the server asked a manger if she could heat it for me, the immediate response was "of course". So I had the seared tuna hot, with the same citrus sauce I love from la lemonade (which was better hot) and two sides for an "AJ special" was pricey but I'm use to that here. She served me my sides then said she would bring the hot tuna out to the table (Katie, likes her job). Lady at the register sold me on a cookie and 'Frozade". Both good but I'll go for my regular blood orange next time. (Make that into a Frozade!) Same woman brought out my tuna and it was pretty damn good, small though. We got to chatting about the festival, she was former manager at one of the above mentioned locations. She mentioned they were new and the community had some reservations. I get the big business stigma, and the portion sizes are small, its pricey, but that's because we're a McDonalds nation. The space is legit, the music was throwback (I'm 30 so when I say throwback I mean 2000's radio hits) and the staff is nice. I work in a restaurant, I know the YELP struggle. Be kind folks.
author: Jack N.
